data.title: 35 Actors You Might Not Have Realized Were Born in Massachusetts
data.meta_description: If someone asked you to name an actor from Massachusetts, you'd probably pick say Matt Damon, Mark Wahlberg, Chris Evans, or John Krasinski. But you might be surprised to know there's a bunch of other famous famous born in the Bay State. Check it out.
data.text:
If someone asked you to name an actor from Massachusetts, you'd probably pick say Matt Damon, Mark Wahlberg, Chris Evans, or John Krasinski.

You'd be right, of course, but you might be surprised to know there are a whole bunch of other actors and actresses born in The Bay State.

And you might be surprised by some of the names that pop up, too.

We're talking Massachusetts celebs from hit TV shows like "Stranger Things" and "Succession" or big movies like "The Hunger Games" and "Kill Bill." These stars have made their mark in the entertainment industry whether they’re playing superheroes, leading dramatic ensembles, or making us laugh until we cry.

Sadly, Ben Affleck won't make the list. Surprised? Affleck was actually born in California. He didn't move to Massachusetts until he was 3 years old. The more you know...

READ MORE: 16 Famous People You Probably Didn’t Realize Were Born in Maine

So next time you’re watching a movie or binging a series, take a moment to appreciate the Bay State’s contribution to Hollywood. You might be shocked to discover some of your favorite characters were brought to life by talent from Massachusetts.

Ready to find out which actors? The list is full of surprises. Who knew Kurt Russell and Amy Poehler were from Massachusetts?

(If you did, good for you. You're getting picked to join the trivia team next time!)

READ MORE: 10 Celebrities You’re Most Likely to Encounter in New Hampshire

The list is organized by month starting with January. Let's take a look.
